image.altText: ANZAC Dawn service at Melbourne's Shine of Remembrance

props.synopsis: Bunurong and Gunditjmara man Uncle Mark Brown was booed and heckled by members of the crowd at Melbourne's Shrine of Remembrance on Friday morning.

title.children: 'Neo-Nazis' condemned for disrupting Anzac Day service in Melbourne

image.altText: Uncle Mark Brown

props.synopsis: The heckling at Melbourne’s Anzac Day service mirrors the long, quiet and painful exclusion of Black diggers from the national conversation.

title.children: The Neo-Nazi heckling at Melbourne's Anzac Day echoes our past pain

image.altText: Pilbara Minerals spodumene rock

props.synopsis: China now dominates the entire rare earths ecosystem, refining around 90 per cent of all coveted elements. It leaves Trump's America particularly vulnerable, as the Albanese government proposes a national stockpile.

title.children: How Trump dealt himself a dud hand on rare earths

image.altText: Rescuers look for survivors amid the rubble of a building

props.synopsis: The US president demands Moscow ceases bombarding the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv as Washington attempts to broker a peace deal.

title.children: Trump 'not happy' with Putin's missile attack on Kyiv

image.altText: Composite Duttts Albo

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese have yet to set foot in an Indigenous community during their election campaigns. However, both have made multiple visits to Melbourne.

title.children: The places political leaders have been avoiding this election

image.altText: Pauline Hanson with daughter Lee Hanson with some hot chips.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson, the leader of One Nation, has worked in politics for nearly three decades. Now, her daughter Lee is hoping to join her — running as a Senate candidate in southern Tasmania.

title.children: After years of urging, Pauline Hanson's daughter is running for One Nation

image.altText: A woman looks sadly at a tablet device displaying a photograph of a young man with a beard who is wearing a turban.

props.synopsis: Police say a 22-year-old handed himself in after Ekampreet Sahni Singh, 18, was shot and killed at Bar Beach on Wednesday night.

title.children: Detectives arrest man over deadly teen shooting in Newcastle car park

image.altText: A stone pillar bearing the Australian Army insignia stands in a car park. It is missing a plaque.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the incident, but locals in the Victorian town of Loch are calling for the plaques to be returned with no questions asked.

title.children: 'Despicable' theft of WWI plaques sparks outrage in tiny town

image.altText: Will Setterfield marks under pressure from Scott Pendlebury.

props.synopsis: Amid overcast conditions, Collingwood and Essendon meet in their traditional Anzac Day match at the MCG. Follow live.

title.children: Magpies and Bombers locked in arm wrestle at wet MCG

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We are underway at the MCG

image.altText: A commemorative ceremony is held before a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Roosters and Dragons will lock horns at the Sydney Football Stadium to kick-off the NRL's Anzac Day triple-header. Follow live.

title.children: Roosters and Dragons face-off to begin Anzac Day triple-header

image.altText: The two popes sit across from one another in a library with a large white box on the table between them

props.synopsis: Just 10 days after Pope Francis was appointed head of the Catholic Church, he received an ominous gift from his predecessor — a large white box.

title.children: Pope Francis was once given a box full of 'abuse, corruption, dark dealings'

image.altText: US defense secretary pete hegseth smirks at the camera

props.synopsis: The unsecured internet connection is the latest revelation about Mr Hegseth's use of the app and raises the possibility that sensitive defence information could have been hacked.

title.children: Hegseth had 'dirty' internet line in his office to use Signal, sources say

image.altText: Line of people voting at Perth polling station.

props.synopsis: More than a million people have already cast their ballots for the federal election early. Some experts say the polling day has just become the last day to vote.

title.children: Early voting becomes new normal in Australia

image.altText: A man holds a sign at a protest that reads, "Water crimes, war crimes" among a sea of green and white flags

props.synopsis: Relations between India and Pakistan deteriorate after an attack left 26 people dead, with New Delhi blaming Islamabad for the violence.

title.children: Will Pakistan go to war with India over water?

image.altText: Monash IVF sign

props.synopsis: The fertility company has responded to questions from the Australian Securities Exchange after its recent embryo mix-up dropped the share price.

title.children: Monash IVF responds to ASX after share price tumbled in baby mix-up

image.altText: Two seashells.

props.synopsis: A school student has discovered a "very, very rare" seashell during a school holiday session at the Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery.

title.children: 8yo girl makes 'astounding' discovery of tiny, rare seashell at museum

image.altText: Wreaths on a beach with a shipwreck in the background.

props.synopsis: More than a century after hospital ship TSS Maheno was wrecked on the shores of K'gari (Fraser Island), families of its crew have gathered for a special Anzac Day ceremony.

title.children: This Queensland island shipwreck once rescued Anzacs from Gallipoli

image.altText: Peter Dutton with Andrew Hastie, campaigning in Perth

props.synopsis: Whatever the result on May 3, even people within the Liberals think they have run a very poor national campaign. Not just poor, but odd.

title.children: Coalition's campaign lacks good planning and enough elbow grease

image.altText: Four brand new cars on a production line are inspected by factory workers.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's promise to end electric vehicle subsidies could drive up prices for popular EVs by more than $15,000 under a typical novated lease and have an almost immediate effect on sales.

title.children: Coalition vow to end EV lease discount may inflate prices $15K

image.altText: Two shelves full of sake bottles, back-lit on a yellow wall

props.synopsis: Over the last decade, Australia has emerged as one of the most promising international markets for Japanese sake.

title.children: Australia's thirst for sake surges as imports and local brewing boom

image.altText: A middle-aged, fair-haired woman in a brightly-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Katy Gallagher says her seniority as finance minister helps her advocate for Canberra. She admits independent Senator David Pocock is popular, but says her party has more muscle.

title.children: Gallagher seeks fourth Senate win but concedes Pocock's popularity

image.altText: Moesha Johnson smiles

props.synopsis: After winning silver at the Paris Olympics, Moesha Johnson knew she needed to keep swimming or risk falling out of the sport, so she traversed the globe competing. But despite being away, Johnson kept a deep fire for home burning within her.

title.children: Paris silver could have been the end for Mo, but she knew she wasn't done

image.altText: Smoke fills the sky from a wildfire amidst pine trees in new jersey

props.synopsis: Police allege Joseph Kling left the wooden pallets without fully extinguishing the blaze which sparked the wildfire.

title.children: Teenager charged with arson after US fire forces evacuation of 5,000 people

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Elephants pack their trunks, a trailblazing pope and an exchange of nice words

image.altText: Composite of pop star Katy Perry wear oragne outfit with white background, left, with Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry, right

props.synopsis: It's a battle between Katy Perry and Katie Perry. One is an international pop super star, the other an Australian fashion designer. Now, after 15 years the case has reached its climax, landing in the High Court. So, who will get to claim the name?

title.children: ABC News Daily: Katie Perry vs Katy Perry in the High Court

image.altText: A woman in a white top smiles and her 2 year old son sit at a table, look at the camera smiling

props.synopsis: Tax rebates for rural Australians were last updated more than 30 years ago. Voters say it is time for them to be on the election agenda.

title.children: Rural voters want zonal tax offset updates this election

image.altText: A man standing inside a room, in front of a traditional Aboriginal painting, and looking serious.

props.synopsis: The organisation representing Darwin's Aboriginal traditional owners is urging remote community leaders, alongside the territory’s land councils, to join forces to help stamp out violent crime in the NT capital.

title.children: Aboriginal organisation urges 'systemic change' after NT supermarket stabbing

image.altText: The exterior of the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre, with barbed wire in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A former inmate at Darwin's notorious Don Dale Youth Detention Centre claims he was forced to "fight other children" and spend hours cutting grass with scissors in a lawsuit against the NT government.

title.children: Lawsuit claims Don Dale teens forced to fight for guards' 'entertainment'

image.altText: A package of energy drink powder open showing a white substance inside.

props.synopsis: A man has faced court over the Northern Territory's "largest ever" ketamine bust, after investigators found drugs with a street value of $800,000 concealed in energy drink and protein bar packs.

title.children: Ketamine found hidden in protein packs sparks elaborate police ploy

image.altText: Ralph Fiennes talkes to a fellow cardinal in the film Conclave.

props.synopsis: As Conclave movie streaming tops Australia's watch list, we go behind the scenes with its cast and a historian, while real life cardinals rush to The Vatican.

title.children: What the film Conclave gets right (and wrong) about electing a new pope

image.altText: A close-up image of a woman's face with red crosses visible on her eyeballs.

props.synopsis: In this largely Irish-language film, featuring almost exclusively women, you'll find many of the horror tropes you'd expect, along with masterfully slow reveals.

title.children: Irish fairy folklore conjured to terrifying effect in new horror film

image.altText: Political candidate advertising a-frames set up on a lawn.

props.synopsis: The retirement of the incumbent and a well-resourced campaign from a local surgeon turned independent is shaking up the status quo in the seat of Forrest.

title.children: Federal WA seat 'vulnerable' after 50 years as safe Liberal territory

image.altText: A group of people running under trees.

props.synopsis: An increasing number of women are signing up to local run clubs, even tackling their first marathon. But safety fears once the sun sets are hampering their training efforts.

title.children: How women's running changes once the sun sets
